name: Hanuman
title: Bhakta Shiromani | Lord of Strength and Devotion
affiliation: Sanatana Dharma | Devotee of Lord Rama
bio: Hanuman, also known as Anjaneya or Maruti, is one of the most revered figures in Hindu mythology and a central character in the Ramayana. He is known for his unbreakable devotion to Lord Rama and his incredible strength, wisdom, and valor. As the son of the wind god Vayu, Hanuman possesses superhuman abilities. He played a key role in locating Sita, burning down Lanka, and leading the monkey army in the war against Ravana. His name is synonymous with service, dedication, and devotion.
lifeSummary: Hanumanâ€™s life is a timeless example of perfect devotion and duty. Though immensely powerful, he remains humble and never uses his strength for ego. His love for Rama is pure, selfless, and complete. As a Chiranjivi, he is believed to still be alive, blessing devotees who remember him with faith. Hanuman is worshipped for protection, courage, and victory over evil. He is also the embodiment of breath (prana), and his stories continue to inspire millions with lessons of loyalty, humility, and spiritual strength.
